channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Here’s the first of Hyundai’s new 800-volt EVs—the Ioniq 5
item.description: Due this fall, it features clever fast-charging tech and an expansive interior.

item.title: Epic will pay off class-action loot-box settlement with in-game currency
item.description: Fortnite and Rocket League players will get over $78 million in digital goods.

item.title: Humans had never seen a spacecraft land on another planet—until now
item.description: “I can, and have, watched those videos for hours.”

item.title: Microsoft throws Google under the bus in European news fight
item.description: Google has blasted “link tax” proposals as antithetical to the open Web.

item.title: Huawei’s new $2,800 foldable phone copies Samsung’s Galaxy Fold line
item.description: The phone looks great, but can Huawei even get the parts for it?

item.title: AT&T and Frontier have let phone networks fall apart, Calif. regulator finds
item.description: AT�T raised phone prices 153% over a decade as service got steadily worse.

item.title: Software bugs reportedly keep Arizona inmates jailed past release dates
item.description: State law was updated in 2019, but the state’s software suite still hasn’t been.

item.title: Apple beats Samsung in phone sales for first time since 2016
item.description: Apple sold almost 80 million phones in Q4 2020.

item.title: Self-driving companies are inching toward fully driverless service
item.description: Motional has completed 100,000 rides with safety drivers in Las Vegas.

item.title: Blaming a wiggly jet stream on climate change? Not so fast
item.description: The hypothesis is easy to understand, but it’s far from a consensus.

item.title: Consumer Reports creates a “green choice” for vehicle reviews
item.description: The publication will now grade vehicles according to their environmental impact.

item.title: Take-Two DMCA takes down reverse-engineered GTA source code
item.description: EULA prohibitions likely prevent any fair use arguments.

item.title: After Saturday’s engine failure, Boeing says many 777s should be grounded
item.description: Many of the engine components fell over populated areas.

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, pt 7: The quantum century
item.description: Manipulating quantum devices has been like getting an intoxicating new superpower for society.

item.title: The AI research paper was real. The “co-author” wasn’t
item.description: An MIT professor found his name on two papers with which he had no connection.

item.title: New malware found on 30,000 Macs has security pros stumped
item.description: With no payload, analysts are struggling to learn what this mature malware does.

item.title: As coronavirus variants spread, the US struggles to keep up
item.description: Without federal strategy or enough funding, US sequencing superpowers don’t work.

item.title: What’s new in the first Android 12 Developer Preview
item.description: Lots of hidden features, and hints that the leak from the other day is true.

item.title: Diablo II Resurrected tops BlizzCon announcement flurry
item.description: Expected announcements for Diablo IV, Diablo Immortal, Hearthstone, more.

item.title: Study blames Earth’s magnetic field flip for climate change, extinctions
item.description: Study suggests that one magnetic event caused everything from extinctions to art.

item.title: Bitcoin’s value just passed $1 trillion
item.description: Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto may have mined 1M bitcoins worth $55 billion.

item.title: Pfizer vaccine doesn’t need ultra-cold storage after all, company says
item.description: The pharma giant and partner BioNTech have asked FDA to revise the vaccine’s label.

item.title: NASA releases “exhilarating” image of Mars rover just above the planet
item.description: “It is exhilarating. It is absolutely exhilarating.”

item.title: Apple faces development hurdles with MagSafe battery pack accessory
item.description: Development ran into a hitch when software falsely reported overheating.

item.title: It took a year, but Gwyneth Paltrow figured out how to exploit the pandemic
item.description: Paltrow treats her long COVID with $8,600 hiking necklace, $112 mocktail glass.

item.title: Comcast reluctantly drops data-cap enforcement in 12 states for rest of 2021
item.description: ISP grants reprieve in Northeast but still caps users in most of its US territory.

item.title: UK Supreme Court says Uber drivers are not independent contractors
item.description: Uber’s “gig economy” business model is under attack around the world.

item.title: Valve gets dragged into Apple and Epic’s legal fight over Fortnite
item.description: Apple seeks vast troves of Steam sales data; Valve says it’s irrelevant to the case.

item.title: New browser-tracking hack works even when you flush caches or go incognito
item.description: At least 4 top browsers affected by “powerful tracking vector,” researchers say.

item.title: Burning Crusade Classic leaks ahead of BlizzCon
item.description: BlizzCon leak includes vague “2021” release window, offers option to stay “vanilla.”

item.title: Microsoft says SolarWinds hackers stole source code for 3 products
item.description: The company said it found no indication the breach allowed customers to be hacked.

item.title: Perseverance on Mars: Where it is, and what the next steps are
item.description: NASA’s first chat about its newest rover talks about the landing and what’s next.

item.title: Robinhood says GameStop volatility was a “1 in 3.5 million” black swan
item.description: CEO Tenev tells House committee quicker trade settlements would prevent a repeat.

item.title: The Land Rover Defender—rugged, charming, but drinks like a fish
item.description: Off-road utility is paid for at the gas pump.

item.title: Tech groups sue Maryland to block new digital-ad tax from going into effect
item.description: The countdown to lawsuit o’clock basically started the second legislators voted.

item.title: Microsoft Office 2021 is on its way
item.description: Dark mode is the new hotness.

item.title: Perseverance rover has landed safely on Mars
item.description: Only the second time NASA’s skycrane has placed a rover on Mars' surface.

item.title: “Shameful and inhumane”: DeSantis threatens to withhold vaccine amid criticism
item.description: Pop-up vaccination site serves “whitest demographic, the richest demographic.”

item.title: Let them fight! Mortal Kombat red-band trailer gives fans what they want
item.description: Reboot of popular franchise finally emerges from development hell.

item.title: Apple is already working on developing 6G wireless technology
item.description: 6G is still many years away, but Apple doesn’t want to depend on Qualcomm again.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Nintendo Joy-Cons, Apple’s M1 Mac mini, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on Roombas, gaming keyboards, and the iPad Air.

item.title: What to expect from the dramatic Mars Perseverance landing [UPDATED with livestream]
item.description: This mission brings a lot of new hardware and science to the red planet.

item.title: Uber: Bankrupt engineer Levandowski is hiding millions from creditors
item.description: Judge views Levandowski’s financial antics with an “incredibly jaundiced eye.”

item.title: House Republicans propose nationwide ban on municipal broadband networks
item.description: GOP claims ban would “promote competition by limiting government-run networks.”

item.title: Google announces the Android 12 Developer Preview
item.description: Google promises a revamped notification UI, lots of other changes.

item.title: Facebook news ban is “arrogant,” Australia will not be “intimidated,” PM says
item.description: Deploying a blunt instrument on a whole nation is going just as well as you’d guess.

item.title: Deep in the heart of Texas’ collapsing power grid
item.description: Everything in Texas went wrong at once.

item.title: Acting NASA chief says 2024 Moon landing no longer a “realistic” target
item.description: “We are reviewing the program for the most efficient path forward.”
